instructions: Consider a function f that maps 5-permutations from the set S = {1, …, 20} to 5-subsets from S. The function takes a 5-permutation and removes the ordering on the elements.
question:
(c)

How many permutations are mapped onto the subset {12, 3, 13, 4, 19}?
answer: 5! because there are 5! ways to order the elements in {12, 3, 13, 4, 19}.
